alert.note: Alert for East Glacier Park Region; Northern High Plains; Southern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 10 at 2:26AM MST until March 11 at 5:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow. Additional snow accumulations mostly between 4 and 8, but up to 12 inches possible in the mountains. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...The Continental Divide along the Rocky Mountain Front, and Northern High Plains. * WHEN...Until 11 AM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult and tire chains may be required for some vehicles. Those in the backcountry should ensure they are prepared for dangerous conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Significant blowing and drifting snow will especially impact the portion of U.S. Highway 2 over Marias Pass and portions of U.S. Highway 89.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock.
